#227

- Growing gregariously in small group on small ridge in low oak/hickory woodland area.
- Caps bald, chocolate brown, conical when young later flattening out with a raised dark brown center and white margin.
- Lamellae depressed at stipe apex, marginate: tan edges with brown faces. Short gills frequent.
- Stipe fibrous/iridescent, curved with pinkish colors on basal mycelium.
- Smell: faintly spermatic.
- KOH: dark brown on pileipellis.
- Microscopy: Mounted in Melzer's Reagent.
